page.title: 06PROMENADE AND TOWER GROUNDS
page.content: THE PROMENADE:The prom. at New Brighton goes right along the River Mersey and the estuary. People walk along this and, sometimes, it is very full. At one place near the sea there is an amusement arcade where the pier used to be. There is a pool seperated from the river by a wall where people can sail boats. The river is very dirty and nobody swims there. (K. SQUIRE (10). THE TOWER GROUNDS: New Brighton once had a tower and a ballroom but these have gone. The tower grounds are now an open area of grass and trees leading to the prom. Lots of people go there to play on swings, walk their dogs or play football. Children play with their BMX bikes on the ramps that have been built there. Sometimes you can find pieces of the tower if you look very hard. ( N.PARRY (10))
